quotesForSite.quote: Massachusetts natural gas prices up 93%, electricity up 65% over the last 10 years - 2-3 times faster than the national average.
quotesForSite.source: Fall River Reporter analysis of EIA/BLS data

quotesForSite.quote: Median home prices have risen 73% since 2000, while median household income has risen only 4% over the same period, after adjusting for inflation.

The typical Massachusetts household earned $131,675 annually over the 2020-2024 period, a 4.1 percent increase from 2015-2019 after adjusting for inflation... trailing the national average of 5.5 percent.

Massachusetts' private sector per capita real gross state product increased by 11.9 percent, trailing the national average of 13.3 percent... even farther behind Florida (17.2%), Texas (15.9%), and New Hampshire (14.8%).
Tax levies grew by 49.5% ($7.2 billion) from $14.6 billion to $21.8 billion from FY2015 to FY2024.
